content.description: A super fun but short stand start to Slip Slap Slide. Start matched on an incut sloper on the arete and follow the juggy slopers on the arete that bring you to the top of the boulder to top out.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the left side arete of the larger face

content.description: Sit start far left on the boulder with one hand on a quartzy sloper on the arete and the other on a 1-1.5 pad crimp at about knee height just under the arete. Find tricky feet and slap up a few slopers to get to several nice slopey rails that take you to the top of the boulder.
content.location: starts on the left side of the larger vertical face, tops out at the highest point on the boulder

content.description: This climbs the right arete of the taller vertical side of the boulder using a couple of crimps on the face.
content.location: The right arete of the taller side of the boulder

content.description: Directly across the street from the parking pull-off is a lowball boulder. The side facing away from the road has several climbs on it. There is a very nice babbling brook to add to the ambiance.
